meanings.definition: Cause extreme fear or anxiety in (someone)
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm terrorizes my dog, making him hide under the bed.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie really terrorizes young children, giving them nightmares.
meanings.sent3: The tiny spider terrorizes the big, tough cat, causing it to jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The thought of failing the test terrorizes me like a monster lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house attraction is designed to terrorize visitors with spooky surprises.

meanings.sent1: The bully terrorizes the other kids on the playground, making them give up their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The dictator terrorizes the citizens, forcing them to obey his every command.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten terrorizes the older cat by pouncing on its tail.
meanings.sent4: The aggressive competitor terrorizes the market, pushing out smaller businesses.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise of the construction site terrorizes the peaceful neighborhood with constant disruptions.
